quote:
Clear water flows over white rock,
the autumn moon shines bright,
so clear is the original face.
Who dares say it is or is not?
author: Son'gyong Sunim, Korean nun

quote:
The pillar pulls out the bone sideways,
the void shows its claws and fangs;
even if one profoundly understands,
there is still sand in the eye.
author: Nun Jiaoan (China, 11th cent. CE)

quote:
With this and that I tried to keep the bucket together,
and then the bottom fell out.
Where water does not collect,
the moon does not dwell.
author: Laywoman Chiyono (Japan, 13th cent. CE)

quote:
Up on the high slopes, I see only old woodcutters.
Everyone has the spirit of the knife and the axe.
How can they see the mountain flowers
reflected in the water—glorious, red?
author: Laywoman Chen (China, c. 600-800 CE)

quote: Greed, hatred and ignorance rise endlessly:  I vow to abandon them.
author: Second Bodhisattva Vow

quote: Sentient beings are numberless:  I vow to save them.
author: First Bodhisattva Vow

quote: Dharma gates are countless:  I vow to awake to them.
author: Third Bodhisattva Vow

quote: The Buddha way is uncontrived:  I vow to embody it fully.
author: Fourth Bodhisattva Vow

quote:
See and realize
that this world
is not permanent.
Neither late nor early flowers
will remain.
author: Ryokan

quote:
Great is the robe of liberation,
a formless field of benefaction.
Buddhas have authentically transmitted it.
Ancestors have intimately received it.
Beyond wide, beyond narrow,
beyond cloth, beyond threads,
maintain it thus,
then you are called a keeper of the robe.
author: Ryokan

quote:
If someone asks
about the mind of this monk:
say it is no more than
a passage of wind
in the vast sky.
author: Ryokan

quote:
Although from the beginning
I knew
the world is impermanent,
not a moment passes
when my sleeves are dry.
author: Ryokan

quote:
One thing
the thief left behind—
moon in my window.
author: Ryokan

quote:
Mountain forms are the Buddha's Body,
Valley streams are his Long Broad Tongue.
At night I hear their myriad hymns of praise—
How can I tell you what they say?
author: Su Tung-P'o

quote:
It is easy to come to some realization.

It is difficult to manifest that realization,
moment by moment.
author: Dae Gak

quote:
To study the Way
is to study the self.

To study the self
is to forget the self.

To forget the self is to be brought to life
by myriad things.
author: Dogen

quote:
Even though
I may see it again
how can I sleep tonight?
— autumn moon.
author: Dogen
